basics.name: Ronnakrit Rattanasriampaipong
basics.label: NOAA Climate & Global Change Postdoctoral Fellow
basics.summary: A Thai-born paleoceanographer/organic geochemist, switched from a background in petroleum geology to paleoclimate research. I am interested in the application of organic geochemistry to understand the Earth's climate system and the carbon cycle. My current research focuses on the development of a full proxy system model for TEX_{86} paleotemperature proxy.

work.name: Department of Geosciences, The University of Arizona
work.position: NOAA Climate & Global Change Postdoctoral Fellow
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.
